gupta_somya: Hi Rega, I believe the issues that you raise are important but don't you think development of this nation is more important than discussing these first world free internet issues? The social media only picked up its pace in the recent years but the real issues like Poverty, Corruption, Unemployment, Scams have been going on for 70 years. As much as I hate to see Muslims being lynched, I also hate kashmiri pandits being hurt. We say that look at the MP and vote but do we realize that we would still need a PM to lead the country. All these years Congress kept fucking up this nation, 70 years later Rahul Gandhi still talks about removing poverty when that should have been done long ago while his older generations were ruling the nation. We brought Modi for change and now when it's happening its making us all uncomfortable. We talk about "change" all the time but we forget that change is the basis of growth. All the fuck ups that BJP did wouldn't have taken place had the nation not have been fucked up so badly in the past. Demonetisation wouldn't have been needed if the black money didn't exist in the first place. Also, as far as free media is concerned I think you saying Fuck Modi is enough for you to realize that it actually is free. You're expressing your opinions dissing the PM. Sharing your thoughts and with full freedom. The problem is that we are privileged people, we don't have to think about issues like sanitization when we now even have period pain relief available at our disposal. We don't have to think about roads because live in metropolitan cities and travel in cars. We don't have cry about coal chulas because we have regular supply of gas. If you will look dig the surface you'll realize what kind of change is actually needed. My vote is for development and for all those poor people who need basic amenities and for those who don't have toilets. I feel you're just scratching the surface of the real issues.
